is a Solidity interface definition to the Safe account.","events":{"AddedOwner(address)":{"params":{"owner":"The address of the new owner."}},"ApproveHash(bytes32,address)":{"params":{"approvedHash":"The hash that was approved.","owner":"The owner that approved it."}},"ChangedFallbackHandler(address)":{"params":{"handler":"The address of the new fallback handler."}},"ChangedGuard(address)":{"params":{"guard":"The address of the new transaction guard."}},"ChangedModuleGuard(address)":{"params":{"moduleGuard":"The address of the new module transaction guard."}},"ChangedThreshold(uint256)":{"params":{"threshold":"The new threshold for authorizing Safe transactions."}},"DisabledModule(address)":{"params":{"module":"The address of the disabled module."}},"EnabledModule(address)":{"params":{"module":"The address of the enabled module."}},"ExecutionFailure(bytes32,uint256)":{"details":"This event is emitted when {execTransaction} is configured to not revert on failed execution.      The Safe's nonce will increment and payment for the transaction will be processed.","params":{"payment":"The payment amount.","txHash":"The Safe transaction hash."}},"ExecutionFromModuleFailure(address)":{"params":{"module":"The address of the module that executed the transaction."}},"ExecutionFromModuleSuccess(address)":{"params":{"module":"The address of the module that executed the transaction."}},"ExecutionSuccess(bytes32,uint256)":{"params":{"payment":"The payment amount.","txHash":"The Safe transaction hash."}},"RemovedOwner(address)":{"params":{"owner":"The address of the old owner."}},"SafeReceived(address,uint256)":{"params":{"sender":"The address that sent the tokens.","value":"The native token value that was received."}},"SafeSetup(address,address[],uint256,address,address)":{"params":{"fallbackHandler":"The address of the initial fallback handler configured for the Safe.","initializer":"The address of the setup initializer contract.","initiator":"Caller of the {setup} function.","owners":"The initial owners that the safe was set up with.","threshold":"The initial signature threshold."}},"SignMsg(bytes32)":{"params":{"msgHash":"The hash the message that was signed."}}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"VERSION()":{"returns":{"_0":"The version string."}},"addOwnerWithThreshold(address,uint256)":{"details":"This can only be done via a Safe transaction.      \u26a0\ufe0f\u26a0\ufe0f\u26a0\ufe0f A Safe can set itself as an owner which is a valid setup for EIP-7702 delegations.      However, if address of the accounts is not an EOA and cannot sign for itself, you can      potentially block access to the account completely. For example, if you have a `n/n`      Safe (so `threshold == ownerCount`) and one of the owners is the Safe itself and not      an EIP-7702 delegated account, then it will not be possible to produce a valid      signature for the Safe. \u26a0\ufe0f\u26a0\ufe0f\u26a0\ufe0f","params":{"_threshold":"New threshold.","owner":"New owner address."}},"approveHash(bytes32)":{"details":"This can be used with a pre-approved hash transaction signature.      IMPORTANT: The approved hash stays approved forever. There's no revocation mechanism, so it behaves similarly to ECDSA signatures.","params":{"hashToApprove":"The hash to mark as approved for signatures that are verified by this contract."}},"approvedHashes(address,bytes32)":{"params":{"messageHash":"The hash of message to check.","owner":"The owner address that may have approved a hash."},"returns":{"_0":"An integer denoting whether or not the hash is approved by the owner.         A non-zero value indicates that the hash is approved."}},"changeThreshold(uint256)":{"details":"This can only be done via a Safe transaction.","params":{"_threshold":"New threshold."}},"checkNSignatures(address,bytes32,bytes,uint256)":{"details":"Since the EIP-1271 does an external call, be mindful of reentrancy attacks.","params":{"dataHash":"Hash of the data (could be either a message hash or transaction hash).","executor":"Address that executes the transaction.        \u26a0\ufe0f\u26a0\ufe0f\u26a0\ufe0f Make sure that the executor address is a legitimate executor.        Incorrectly passed the executor might reduce the threshold by 1 signature. \u26a0\ufe0f\u26a0\ufe0f\u26a0\ufe0f","requiredSignatures":"Amount of required valid signatures.","signatures":"Packed signature data that should be verified.                   Can be packed ECDSA signature `r:bytes32 || s:bytes32 || v:uint8`, contract signature (EIP-1271), or approved hash."}},"checkSignatures(address,bytes32,bytes)":{"params":{"dataHash":"Hash of the data (could be either a message hash or transaction hash).","executor":"Address that executes the transaction.        \u26a0\ufe0f\u26a0\ufe0f\u26a0\ufe0f Make sure that the executor address is a legitimate executor.        Incorrectly passed the executor might reduce the threshold by 1 signature. \u26a0\ufe0f\u26a0\ufe0f\u26a0\ufe0f","signatures":"Packed signature data that should be verified.                   Can be packed ECDSA signature `r:bytes32 || s:bytes32 || v:uint8`, contract signature (EIP-1271), or approved hash."}},"disableModule(address,address)":{"details":"This can only be done via a Safe transaction.","params":{"module":"Module to be removed.","prevModule":"Previous module in the modules linked list. If the module to be        disabled is the first (or only) element of the list, `prevModule` MUST be        set to the sentinel address `0x1` (referred to as `SENTINEL_MODULES` in the        implementation)."}},"domainSeparator()":{"details":"Returns the domain separator for this contract, as defined in the EIP-712 standard.","returns":{"_0":"The domain separator hash."}},"enableModule(address)":{"details":"This can only be done via a Safe transaction.","params":{"module":"Module to be whitelisted."}},"execTransaction(address,uint256,bytes,uint8,uint256,uint256,uint256,address,address,bytes)":{"details":"The fees are always transferred, even if the user transaction fails.      This method doesn't perform any sanity check of the transaction, such as:      - if the contract at `to` address has code or not      - if the `gasToken` is a contract or not      It is the responsibility of the caller to perform such checks.","params":{"baseGas":"Base gas costs that are independent of the transaction execution (e.g. base transaction fee, signature check, payment of the refund).","data":"Data payload of the Safe transaction.","gasPrice":"Gas price that should be used for the payment calculation.","gasToken":"Token address (or 0 for the native token) that is used for the payment.","operation":"Operation type of the Safe transaction: 0 for `CALL` and 1 for `DELEGATECALL`.","refundReceiver":"Address of receiver of the gas payment (or 0 for `tx.origin`).","safeTxGas":"Gas that should be used for the Safe transaction.","signatures":"Packed signature data that should be verified.                   Can be packed ECDSA signature `r:bytes32 || s:bytes32 || v:uint8`, contract signature (EIP-1271), or approved hash.","to":"Destination address of Safe transaction.","value":"Native token value of the Safe transaction."},"returns":{"success":"Boolean indicating transaction's success."}},"execTransactionFromModule(address,uint256,bytes,uint8)":{"params":{"data":"Data payload of the module transaction.","operation":"Operation type of the module transaction: 0 for `CALL` and 1 for `DELEGATECALL`.","to":"Destination address of the module transaction.","value":"Native token value of the module transaction."},"returns":{"success":"Boolean flag indicating if the call succeeded."}},"execTransactionFromModuleReturnData(address,uint256,bytes,uint8)":{"params":{"data":"Data payload of the module transaction.","operation":"Operation type of the module transaction: 0 for `CALL` and 1 for `DELEGATECALL`.","to":"Destination address of the module transaction.","value":"Native token value of the module transaction."},"returns":{"returnData":"Data returned by the call.","success":"Boolean flag indicating if the call succeeded."}},"getModulesPaginated(address,uint256)":{"details":"If all entries fit into a single page, the next pointer will be `address(0x1)`.      If another page is present, next will be the last element of the returned array.","params":{"pageSize":"Maximum number of modules that should be returned. Must be greater than 0.","start":"Start of the page. Has to be a module or start pointer (`address(0x1)`)."},"returns":{"array":"Array of modules.","next":"Start of the next page."}},"getOwners()":{"returns":{"_0":"Array of Safe owners."}},"getStorageAt(uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"length":"The number of words (32 bytes) of data to read.","offset":"The offset in the current contract's storage in words to start reading from."},"returns":{"_0":"The bytes that were read."}},"getThreshold()":{"returns":{"_0":"Threshold number."}},"getTransactionHash(address,uint256,bytes,uint8,uint256,uint256,uint256,address,address,uint256)":{"params":{"_nonce":"Safe transaction nonce.","baseGas":"Base gas costs that are independent of the transaction execution (e.g. base transaction fee, signature check, payment of the refund).","data":"Data payload of the Safe transaction.","gasPrice":"Gas price that should be used for the payment calculation.","gasToken":"Token address (or 0 for the native token) that is used for the payment.","operation":"Operation type of the Safe transaction: 0 for `CALL` and 1 for `DELEGATECALL`.","refundReceiver":"Address of receiver of the gas payment (or 0 for `tx.origin`).","safeTxGas":"Gas that should be used for the Safe transaction.","to":"Destination address of Safe transaction.","value":"Native token value of the Safe transaction."},"returns":{"_0":"Safe transaction hash."}},"isModuleEnabled(address)":{"returns":{"_0":"True if the module is enabled, false otherwise."}},"isOwner(address)":{"returns":{"_0":"Boolean if `owner` is an owner of the Safe."}},"nonce()":{"returns":{"_0":"The current nonce."}},"removeOwner(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"This can only be done via a Safe transaction.","params":{"_threshold":"New threshold.","owner":"Owner address to be removed.","prevOwner":"Owner that pointed to the `owner` to be removed in the linked list.        If the owner to be removed is the first (or only) element of the list,        `prevOwner` MUST be set to the sentinel address `0x1` (referred to as        `SENTINEL_OWNERS` in the implementation)."}},"setFallbackHandler(address)":{"details":"1. Only fallback calls without value and with data will be forwarded.      2. Changing the fallback handler can only be done via a Safe transaction.      3. Cannot be set to the Safe itself.      4. \u26a0\ufe0f\u26a0\ufe0f\u26a0\ufe0f IMPORTANT! SECURITY RISK! The fallback handler can be set to any address and all the calls will be forwarded to it,         bypassing all the Safe's access control mechanisms. When setting the fallback handler, make sure to check the address         is a trusted contract and if it supports state changes, it implements the necessary checks. \u26a0\ufe0f\u26a0\ufe0f\u26a0\ufe0f","params":{"handler":"contract to handle fallback calls."}},"setGuard(address)":{"details":"Set a guard that checks Safe transactions before and after execution.      This can only be done via a Safe transaction.      \u26a0\ufe0f\u26a0\ufe0f\u26a0\ufe0f IMPORTANT: Since a guard has full power to block Safe transaction execution,      a broken guard can cause a denial of service for the Safe. Make sure to carefully      audit the guard code and design recovery mechanisms. \u26a0\ufe0f\u26a0\ufe0f\u26a0\ufe0f","params":{"guard":"The address of the guard to be used or the 0 address to disable the guard"}},"setModuleGuard(address)":{"details":"Set a module guard that checks transactions initiated by the module before and after execution.      This can only be done via a Safe transaction.      \u26a0\ufe0f\u26a0\ufe0f\u26a0\ufe0f IMPORTANT: Since a module guard has full power to block Safe transaction execution initiated via a      module, a broken module guard can cause a denial of service for the Safe modules. Make sure to carefully      audit the module guard code and design recovery mechanisms. \u26a0\ufe0f\u26a0\ufe0f\u26a0\ufe0f","params":{"moduleGuard":"The address of the module guard to be used or the zero address to disable the module guard."}},"setup(address[],uint256,address,bytes,address,address,uint256,address)":{"details":"This method can only be called once.      \u26a0\ufe0f\u26a0\ufe0f\u26a0\ufe0f If a proxy was created without setting up, anyone can call setup and claim the proxy. \u26a0\ufe0f\u26a0\ufe0f\u26a0\ufe0f      \u26a0\ufe0f\u26a0\ufe0f\u26a0\ufe0f A Safe can set itself as an owner which is a valid setup for EIP-7702 delegations.      However, if address of the accounts is not an EOA and cannot sign for itself, you can      potentially block access to the account completely. For example, if you have a `n/n`      Safe (so `threshold == ownerCount`) and one of the owners is the Safe itself and not      an EIP-7702 delegated account, then it will not be possible to produce a valid      signature for the Safe. \u26a0\ufe0f\u26a0\ufe0f\u26a0\ufe0f      This method emits a {SafeSetup} event with the setup parameters instead of reading from storage,      which may be inaccurate if the delegate call to `to` modifies the owners, threshold or fallback handler.","params":{"_owners":"Array of initial Safe owners.","_threshold":"Number of required confirmations for a Safe transaction.","data":"Data payload for the `to` initializer contract.","fallbackHandler":"Handler for fallback calls to this contract.","payment":"Value that should be paid.","paymentReceiver":"Address that should receive the payment (or 0 if `tx.origin`).","paymentToken":"Token that should be used for the payment (0 for native token).","to":"Optional initializer contract address. It will be `DELEGATECALL`-ed with `data`.           Use the 0 address to not perform any additional initialization."}},"signedMessages(bytes32)":{"params":{"messageHash":"The hash of message that should be checked."},"returns":{"_0":"An integer denoting whether or not the hash is signed for the Safe.         A non-zero value indicates that the hash is signed."}},"simulateAndRevert(address,bytes)":{"details":"Internally reverts execution to avoid side effects (making it effectively static).      This method reverts with data equal to `abi.encodePacked(uint256(success), uint256(response.length), bytes(response))`.      Specifically, the return data after a call to this method will be:      `success:uint256 || response.length:uint256 || response:bytes`.","params":{"calldataPayload":"Calldata that should be sent to the target contract (encoded method name and arguments).","targetContract":"Address of the contract containing the code to execute."}},"swapOwner(address,address,address)":{"details":"This can only be done via a Safe transaction.      \u26a0\ufe0f\u26a0\ufe0f\u26a0\ufe0f A Safe can set itself as an owner which is a valid setup for EIP-7702 delegations.      However, if address of the accounts is not an EOA and cannot sign for itself, you can      potentially block access to the account completely. For example, if you have a `n/n`      Safe (so `threshold == ownerCount`) and one of the owners is the Safe itself and not      an EIP-7702 delegated account, then it will not be possible to produce a valid      signature for the Safe. \u26a0\ufe0f\u26a0\ufe0f\u26a0\ufe0f","params":{"newOwner":"New owner address.","oldOwner":"Owner address to be replaced.","prevOwner":"Owner that pointed to the `oldOwner` to be replaced in the linked list.        If the owner to be replaced is the first (or only) element of the list,        `prevOwner` MUST be set to the sentinel address `0x1` (referred to as        `SENTINEL_OWNERS` in the implementation)."}}},"title":"Safe Interface","version":1},"userdoc":{"events":{"AddedOwner(address)":{"notice":"An owner was added."},"ApproveHash(bytes32,address)":{"notice":"A transaction hash was approved by an owner."},"ChangedFallbackHandler(address)":{"notice":"The fallback handler has changed."},"ChangedGuard(address)":{"notice":"Transaction guard changed."},"ChangedModuleGuard(address)":{"notice":"The module transaction guard changed."},"ChangedThreshold(uint256)":{"notice":"The signature threshold changed."},"DisabledModule(address)":{"notice":"A module was disabled."},"EnabledModule(address)":{"notice":"A module was enabled."},"ExecutionFailure(bytes32,uint256)":{"notice":"A Safe transaction reverted."},"ExecutionFromModuleFailure(address)":{"notice":"A module transaction reverted during executed."},"ExecutionFromModuleSuccess(address)":{"notice":"A module transaction successfully executed."},"ExecutionSuccess(bytes32,uint256)":{"notice":"A Safe transaction executed."},"RemovedOwner(address)":{"notice":"An owner was removed."},"SafeReceived(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Native tokens were received."},"SafeSetup(address,address[],uint256,address,address)":{"notice":"Safe setup event."},"SignMsg(bytes32)":{"notice":"A Safe message was signed."}},"kind":"user","methods":{"VERSION()":{"notice":"Returns a descriptive version of the Safe contract."},"addOwnerWithThreshold(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Adds the owner `owner` to the Safe and updates the threshold to `_threshold`."},"approveHash(bytes32)":{"notice":"Marks hash `hashToApprove` as approved for `msg.sender`."},"approvedHashes(address,bytes32)":{"notice":"Returns a non-zero value if the `messageHash` is approved by the `owner`."},"changeThreshold(uint256)":{"notice":"Changes the threshold of the Safe to `_threshold`."},"checkNSignatures(address,bytes32,bytes,uint256)":{"notice":"Checks whether the signature provided is valid for the provided data and hash. Reverts otherwise."},"checkSignatures(address,bytes32,bytes)":{"notice":"Checks whether the signature provided is valid for the provided data and hash and executor. Reverts otherwise."},"disableModule(address,address)":{"notice":"Disables the module `module` for the Safe."},"enableModule(address)":{"notice":"Enables the module `module` for the Safe."},"execTransaction(address,uint256,bytes,uint8,uint256,uint256,uint256,address,address,bytes)":{"notice":"Executes a transaction with `operation` to the `to` address with a native token `value` with a `data` payload.          Pays `gasPrice * gasLimit` in `gasToken` token to the `refundReceiver`."},"execTransactionFromModule(address,uint256,bytes,uint8)":{"notice":"Execute `operation` to `to` with native token `value`."},"execTransactionFromModuleReturnData(address,uint256,bytes,uint8)":{"notice":"Execute `operation` to `to` with native token `value` and return data."},"getModulesPaginated(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Returns an array of modules."},"getOwners()":{"notice":"Returns a list of Safe owners."},"getStorageAt(uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Reads `length` bytes of storage in the current contract"},"getThreshold()":{"notice":"Returns the number of required confirmations for a Safe transaction aka the threshold."},"getTransactionHash(address,uint256,bytes,uint8,uint256,uint256,uint256,address,address,uint256)":{"notice":"Returns transaction hash to be signed by owners."},"isModuleEnabled(address)":{"notice":"Returns whether or not a module is enabled."},"isOwner(address)":{"notice":"Returns if `owner` is an owner of the Safe."},"nonce()":{"notice":"Returns the nonce of the Safe contract."},"removeOwner(address,address,uint256)":{"notice":"Removes the owner `owner` from the Safe and updates the threshold to `_threshold`."},"setFallbackHandler(address)":{"notice":"Set Fallback Handler to `handler` for the Safe."},"setGuard(address)":{"notice":"Set Transaction Guard `guard` for the Safe. Make sure you trust the guard."},"setModuleGuard(address)":{"notice":"Set Module Guard `moduleGuard` for the Safe. 8b64ce9893d4749e00d45f3e35b97d58bea7991a53a46ad2cb4ac7a","license":"LGPL-3.0-only","urls":["bzz-raw://8e479819bac550e6c5da7f3ea848f22fd0f54837d082c0d4596b5d209674f211","dweb:/ipfs/QmUjyd2a8yKogjjFPTVisqdSHSaQXiGbBJYUq3KyMZ3wMb"]},"lib/lux-standard/lib/safe-smart-account/contracts/interfaces/INativeCurrencyPaymentFallback.sol":{"keccak256":"0x7ed710eb6640572dcb39c6d2691a07d3884d1538fc3de1993ae29a7698122436","license":"LGPL-3.0-only","urls":["bzz-raw://896fd0fad81b48901181e70ab1074bdc429e0699c4af862b1350d5aa28166b5c","dweb:/ipfs/QmayjMPbqr7zXRrB9GssUBw39sRyfQFXGsQVgGV71VQxRV"]},"lib/lux-standard/lib/safe-smart-account/contracts/interfaces/IOwnerManager.sol":{"keccak256":"0x1bec6b9ecc318f2a273604b0c0cf9ea6446551e92b5cda70119199373339395e","license":"LGPL-3.0-only","urls":["bzz-raw://c09ccb1e0d16c08d109c4b88dc6ae33ae68869b0a7f0decf73885be7ec27dead","dweb:/ipfs/QmdhtbcJ7AF6AwTNiRkjcx8eD6bEiTCvJqmDKZBt4zqAAy"]},"lib/lux-standard/lib/safe-smart-account/contracts/interfaces/ISafe.sol":{"keccak256":"0xd94f2479daeab9106c8cbc9e7cb5e0dc85a0dd9c1b78fa906469ec7e08076438","license":"LGPL-3.0-only","urls":["bzz-raw://9c428793be03f2006e6636bd14a78a52dfbe3c9438524f934b4f2c00ba517eaf","dweb:/ipfs/QmfU83vKeVGLX82knuqMLYrNBCZoFjAy9u9K4sSXC2dqWR"]},"lib/lux-standard/lib/safe-smart-account/contracts/interfaces/IStorageAccessible.sol":{"keccak256":"0x0a06ff2bcca70a1a5926aa71473a515e073b85f217fd3c8594e922880758db1c","license":"LGPL-3.0-only","urls":["bzz-raw://41ee6f1d043a6d021d98eb9e97aa728fe401bfddb6ccbd3502a8394a190c89db","dweb:/ipfs/QmaDAi6w52tsbXBDtDRUdkHS1n8B2YVhkwesiw7zHp5XEE"]}},"version":1}

addOwnerWithThreshold(address,uint256).details: This can only be done via a Safe transaction.       A Safe can set itself as an owner which is a valid setup for EIP-7702 delegations.      However, if address of the accounts is not an EOA and cannot sign for itself, you can      potentially block access to the account completely. For example, if you have a `n/n`      Safe (so `threshold == ownerCount`) and one of the owners is the Safe itself and not      an EIP-7702 delegated account, then it will not be possible to produce a valid      signature for the Safe.

approveHash(bytes32).details: This can be used with a pre-approved hash transaction signature.      IMPORTANT: The approved hash stays approved forever. There's no revocation mechanism, so it behaves similarly to ECDSA signatures.

params.hashToApprove: The hash to mark as approved for signatures that are verified by this contract.

params.messageHash: The hash of message to check.
params.owner: The owner address that may have approved a hash.

returns._0: An integer denoting whether or not the hash is approved by the owner.         A non-zero value indicates that the hash is approved.

changeThreshold(uint256).details: This can only be done via a Safe transaction.

checkNSignatures(address,bytes32,bytes,u.details: Since the EIP-1271 does an external call, be mindful of reentrancy attacks.

params.dataHash: Hash of the data (could be either a message hash or transaction hash).
params.executor: Address that executes the transaction.         Make sure that the executor address is a legitimate executor.        Incorrectly passed the executor might reduce the threshold by 1 signature.
params.signatures: Packed signature data that should be verified.                   Can be packed ECDSA signature `r:bytes32 || s:bytes32 || v:uint8`, contract signature (EIP-1271), or approved hash.

params.dataHash: Hash of the data (could be either a message hash or transaction hash).
params.executor: Address that executes the transaction.         Make sure that the executor address is a legitimate executor.        Incorrectly passed the executor might reduce the threshold by 1 signature.
params.signatures: Packed signature data that should be verified.                   Can be packed ECDSA signature `r:bytes32 || s:bytes32 || v:uint8`, contract signature (EIP-1271), or approved hash.

disableModule(address,address).details: This can only be done via a Safe transaction.

params.prevModule: Previous module in the modules linked list. If the module to be        disabled is the first (or only) element of the list, `prevModule` MUST be        set to the sentinel address `0x1` (referred to as `SENTINEL_MODULES` in the        implementation).

domainSeparator().details: Returns the domain separator for this contract, as defined in the EIP-712 standard.

enableModule(address).details: This can only be done via a Safe transaction.

execTransaction(address,uint256,bytes,ui.details: The fees are always transferred, even if the user transaction fails.      This method doesn't perform any sanity check of the transaction, such as:      - if the contract at `to` address has code or not      - if the `gasToken` is a contract or not      It is the responsibility of the caller to perform such checks.

params.baseGas: Base gas costs that are independent of the transaction execution (e.g. base transaction fee, signature check, payment of the refund).
params.data: Data payload of the Safe transaction.
params.gasPrice: Gas price that should be used for the payment calculation.
params.gasToken: Token address (or 0 for the native token) that is used for the payment.
params.operation: Operation type of the Safe transaction: 0 for `CALL` and 1 for `DELEGATECALL`.
params.refundReceiver: Address of receiver of the gas payment (or 0 for `tx.origin`).
params.safeTxGas: Gas that should be used for the Safe transaction.
params.signatures: Packed signature data that should be verified.                   Can be packed ECDSA signature `r:bytes32 || s:bytes32 || v:uint8`, contract signature (EIP-1271), or approved hash.
params.value: Native token value of the Safe transaction.

params.data: Data payload of the module transaction.
params.operation: Operation type of the module transaction: 0 for `CALL` and 1 for `DELEGATECALL`.
params.to: Destination address of the module transaction.
params.value: Native token value of the module transaction.

returns.success: Boolean flag indicating if the call succeeded.

params.data: Data payload of the module transaction.
params.operation: Operation type of the module transaction: 0 for `CALL` and 1 for `DELEGATECALL`.
params.to: Destination address of the module transaction.
params.value: Native token value of the module transaction.

returns.success: Boolean flag indicating if the call succeeded.

getModulesPaginated(address,uint256).details: If all entries fit into a single page, the next pointer will be `address(0x1)`.      If another page is present, next will be the last element of the returned array.

params.pageSize: Maximum number of modules that should be returned. Must be greater than 0.
params.start: Start of the page. Has to be a module or start pointer (`address(0x1)`).

params.length: The number of words (32 bytes) of data to read.
params.offset: The offset in the current contract's storage in words to start reading from.

params.baseGas: Base gas costs that are independent of the transaction execution (e.g. base transaction fee, signature check, payment of the refund).
params.data: Data payload of the Safe transaction.
params.gasPrice: Gas price that should be used for the payment calculation.
params.gasToken: Token address (or 0 for the native token) that is used for the payment.
params.operation: Operation type of the Safe transaction: 0 for `CALL` and 1 for `DELEGATECALL`.
params.refundReceiver: Address of receiver of the gas payment (or 0 for `tx.origin`).
params.safeTxGas: Gas that should be used for the Safe transaction.
params.value: Native token value of the Safe transaction.

returns._0: True if the module is enabled, false otherwise.
Boolean if `owner` is an owner of the Safe.

removeOwner(address,address,uint256).details: This can only be done via a Safe transaction.

params.prevOwner: Owner that pointed to the `owner` to be removed in the linked list.        If the owner to be removed is the first (or only) element of the list,        `prevOwner` MUST be set to the sentinel address `0x1` (referred to as        `SENTINEL_OWNERS` in the implementation).

setFallbackHandler(address).details: 1. Only fallback calls without value and with data will be forwarded.      2. Changing the fallback handler can only be done via a Safe transaction.      3. Cannot be set to the Safe itself.      4.  IMPORTANT! SECURITY RISK! The fallback handler can be set to any address and all the calls will be forwarded to it,         bypassing all the Safe's access control mechanisms. When setting the fallback handler, make sure to check the address         is a trusted contract and if it supports state changes, it implements the necessary checks.

setGuard(address).details: Set a guard that checks Safe transactions before and after execution.      This can only be done via a Safe transaction.       IMPORTANT: Since a guard has full power to block Safe transaction execution,      a broken guard can cause a denial of service for the Safe. Make sure to carefully      audit the guard code and design recovery mechanisms.

params.guard: The address of the guard to be used or the 0 address to disable the guard

setModuleGuard(address).details: Set a module guard that checks transactions initiated by the module before and after execution.      This can only be done via a Safe transaction.       IMPORTANT: Since a module guard has full power to block Safe transaction execution initiated via a      module, a broken module guard can cause a denial of service for the Safe modules. Make sure to carefully      audit the module guard code and design recovery mechanisms.

params.moduleGuard: The address of the module guard to be used or the zero address to disable the module guard.

setup(address[],uint256,address,bytes,ad.details: This method can only be called once.       If a proxy was created without setting up, anyone can call setup and claim the proxy.        A Safe can set itself as an owner which is a valid setup for EIP-7702 delegations.      However, if address of the accounts is not an EOA and cannot sign for itself, you can      potentially block access to the account completely. For example, if you have a `n/n`      Safe (so `threshold == ownerCount`) and one of the owners is the Safe itself and not      an EIP-7702 delegated account, then it will not be possible to produce a valid      signature for the Safe.       This method emits a {SafeSetup} event with the setup parameters instead of reading from storage,      which may be inaccurate if the delegate call to `to` modifies the owners, threshold or fallback handler.

params._threshold: Number of required confirmations for a Safe transaction.
params.data: Data payload for the `to` initializer contract.
params.fallbackHandler: Handler for fallback calls to this contract.
params.paymentReceiver: Address that should receive the payment (or 0 if `tx.origin`).
params.paymentToken: Token that should be used for the payment (0 for native token).
params.to: Optional initializer contract address. It will be `DELEGATECALL`-ed with `data`.           Use the 0 address to not perform any additional initialization.

params.messageHash: The hash of message that should be checked.

returns._0: An integer denoting whether or not the hash is signed for the Safe.         A non-zero value indicates that the hash is signed.

simulateAndRevert(address,bytes).details: Internally reverts execution to avoid side effects (making it effectively static).      This method reverts with data equal to `abi.encodePacked(uint256(success), uint256(response.length), bytes(response))`.      Specifically, the return data after a call to this method will be:      `success:uint256 || response.length:uint256 || response:bytes`.

params.calldataPayload: Calldata that should be sent to the target contract (encoded method name and arguments).
params.targetContract: Address of the contract containing the code to execute.

swapOwner(address,address,address).details: This can only be done via a Safe transaction.       A Safe can set itself as an owner which is a valid setup for EIP-7702 delegations.      However, if address of the accounts is not an EOA and cannot sign for itself, you can      potentially block access to the account completely. For example, if you have a `n/n`      Safe (so `threshold == ownerCount`) and one of the owners is the Safe itself and not      an EIP-7702 delegated account, then it will not be possible to produce a valid      signature for the Safe.

params.prevOwner: Owner that pointed to the `oldOwner` to be replaced in the linked list.        If the owner to be replaced is the first (or only) element of the list,        `prevOwner` MUST be set to the sentinel address `0x1` (referred to as        `SENTINEL_OWNERS` in the implementation).

VERSION().notice: Returns a descriptive version of the Safe contract.

addOwnerWithThreshold(address,uint256).notice: Adds the owner `owner` to the Safe and updates the threshold to `_threshold`.

approvedHashes(address,bytes32).notice: Returns a non-zero value if the `messageHash` is approved by the `owner`.

changeThreshold(uint256).notice: Changes the threshold of the Safe to `_threshold`.

checkNSignatures(address,bytes32,bytes,u.notice: Checks whether the signature provided is valid for the provided data and hash. Reverts otherwise.

checkSignatures(address,bytes32,bytes).notice: Checks whether the signature provided is valid for the provided data and hash and executor. Reverts otherwise.

disableModule(address,address).notice: Disables the module `module` for the Safe.

enableModule(address).notice: Enables the module `module` for the Safe.

execTransaction(address,uint256,bytes,ui.notice: Executes a transaction with `operation` to the `to` address with a native token `value` with a `data` payload.          Pays `gasPrice * gasLimit` in `gasToken` token to the `refundReceiver`.

execTransactionFromModuleReturnData(addr.notice: Execute `operation` to `to` with native token `value` and return data.

getOwners().notice: Returns a list of Safe owners.

getStorageAt(uint256,uint256).notice: Reads `length` bytes of storage in the current contract

getThreshold().notice: Returns the number of required confirmations for a Safe transaction aka the threshold.

getTransactionHash(address,uint256,bytes.notice: Returns transaction hash to be signed by owners.

isModuleEnabled(address).notice: Returns whether or not a module is enabled.

isOwner(address).notice: Returns if `owner` is an owner of the Safe.

nonce().notice: Returns the nonce of the Safe contract.

removeOwner(address,address,uint256).notice: Removes the owner `owner` from the Safe and updates the threshold to `_threshold`.

setFallbackHandler(address).notice: Set Fallback Handler to `handler` for the Safe.

setGuard(address).notice: Set Transaction Guard `guard` for the Safe. Make sure you trust the guard.

setModuleGuard(address).notice: Set Module Guard `moduleGuard` for the Safe. Make sure you trust the module guard.

setup(address[],uint256,address,bytes,ad.notice: Sets an initial storage of the Safe account.

signedMessages(bytes32).notice: Returns a non-zero value if the `messageHash` is signed for the Safe.

simulateAndRevert(address,bytes).notice: Performs a `DELEGATECALL` to a `targetContract` in the context of self.

swapOwner(address,address,address).notice: Replaces the owner `oldOwner` in the Safe with `newOwner`.
